intro: Microtatorchis clementsii, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area. Microtatorchis clementsii plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
